snippet: Part of a little-remembered artist’s collection is on display at Debra Force Fine Art in Manhattan through the rest of the month.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; works of forgotten society portraitist James Jebusa Shannon are receiving renewed interest, including exhibit at Debra Force Fine Art gallery, while telecommunications executive Jeffrey Chace is trying to call attention to 19th century marine painter Harry Chase; exhibit Luis Moses Gomez: Merchant Pioneer of Colonial New York opens at 1710s Gomez Mill House in Marlboro, NY.
lead_paragraph: Part of a little-remembered artist’s collection is on display at Debra Force Fine Art in Manhattan through the rest of the month.

headline.main: James Jebusa Shannon’s Portraits Rescued From Obscurity
headline.print_headline: James Jebusa Shannon’s Portraits Rescued From Obscurity
